description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9bqcb","text":"Acceptability is one of the four core components of the right to health and one of the seven factors that are considered in formulating recommendations as part of the World Health Organization guidelines, yet it remains challenging to define and measure. Neglected tropical diseases (NTDs) are a group of 21 diseases that affect people living in vulnerable circumstances, and it is estimated that over 1.6 billion people worldwide require either preventive or curative interventions for at least one NTD. Quantitatively measuring a subjective attribute, such as the acceptability of pharmaceutical interventions for the prevention and treatment of NTDs, presents a fundamental challenge. In this systematic review, We will comprehensively outline various methodologies employed to measure and analyze acceptability of pharmaceutical interventions across different studies and NTDs. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8eahv","text":"How is the acceptability of pharmaceutical interventions for the prevention and treatment of neglected tropical diseases quantitatively measured and analyzed in the literature.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":27,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8o9ui","text":"Acceptability is one of the four core components of the right to health and one of the seven factors that are considered in formulating recommendations as part of the World Health Organization guidelines, yet it remains challenging to define and measure. Recent efforts have been made to conceptualize and define treatment acceptability, with Sekhon et al., proposing the following definition: acceptability is a multi-faceted construct that reflects the extent to which people delivering or receiving a healthcare intervention consider it to be appropriate, based on anticipated or experienced cognitive and emotional responses to the intervention. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":342,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46f5g","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eu94t","text":"Neglected tropical diseases (NTDs) are a group of 21 diseases that affect people living in vulnerable circumstances, and it is estimated that over 1.6 billion people worldwide require either preventive or curative interventions for at least one NTD. Quantitatively measuring a subjective attribute, such as the acceptability of pharmaceutical interventions for the prevention and treatment of NTDs, presents a fundamental challenge. For instance, the acceptability of tablets for the elimination of lymphatic filariasis (one of the 21 NTDs) has been measured by both using a composite acceptability score, and as the proportion of individuals that ingested the tablets.  While objectively measurable, participation should not be used synonymously with acceptability.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"v0me","text":"We will investigate studies that investigate the acceptability of pharmaceutical interventions for the\nprevention or treatment of at least 1 of the 21 neglected tropical diseases on human population in any geographic area. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7v8og","text":"We will include studies that focus on the acceptability of any pharmaceutical intervention against at least 1 of the 21 neglected tropical diseases.  The pharmaceutical intervention can include current or developing interventions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ao6qj","text":"Relevant articles include primary research (e.g., cross sectional, cohort, randomized control trials, cluster randomized control trials). We will exclude studies that are secondary research (e.g., literature reviews, editorials). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9pv3e","text":"We will include all study years published in either French or English ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2je53","text":"The two main outcomes include 1) the instrument used to measure acceptability and 2) the method used to analyze acceptability. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"27ht6","text":"This systematic review will comprehensively outline various methodologies employed to measure\nand analyze acceptability of interventions across different studies and NTDs. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Methods and instruments used in the literature to quantitatively analyze the acceptability of pharmaceutical interventions for the prevention and treatment of neglected tropical diseases: a systematic review
title_html: Methods and instruments used in the literature to quantitatively analyze the acceptability of pharmaceutical interventions for the prevention and treatment of neglected tropical diseases: a systematic review
